entry.title: Week 44, 2025: None
entry.content: Activity report for oxcaml/merlin - Week 44, 2025
entry.summary: Activity report for oxcaml/merlin - Week 44, 2025

entry.title: Week 43, 2025: Configuration update to ignore additional LLVM-related compiler flags
entry.content:
Summary

Single configuration improvement merged for LLVM flag compatibility

Activity

  • LLVM flag compatibility improved by Liam Stevenson through updates to ignored compiler flags in src/kernel/mconfig.ml, adding support for -llvm-backend and -no-llvm-backend while reclassifying -llvm-path as a parametrized flag (#192)
entry.summary: Configuration update to ignore additional LLVM-related compiler flags

entry.title: Week 42, 2025: Merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 bringing quotation support, layout polymorphism, mode system updates, and new jkind primitives
entry.content:
Summary

Claude-assisted merge of OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 with conflict resolution and compilation fixes

Activity

  • Mark Shinwell merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 with automated conflict resolution and compilation error fixing using Claude, bringing 168 changed files with 32,413 insertions and 24,515 deletions (#191)
  • Parser and syntax updates with extensive regeneration of parser files affecting 33,963+ lines in parserraw.ml and 11,515+ lines in parserrecover.ml to support new language features (#191)
  • Type system infrastructure changes across ctype, typecore, typedecl, typemod, and typetexp modules totaling hundreds of lines to support staging and layout polymorphism (#191)
  • Mode system overhaul with 1,165+ line changes in mode.ml affecting uniqueness analysis, solver, and type mode inference (#191)
  • Test updates for function recovery, mode recovery, typer cache stamps, type enclosing, typing recovery, and version tests to reflect new compiler behavior (#191)
  • Liam Stevenson provided thorough code review with feedback on conflict resolution choices, suggesting use of /* BEGIN AVOID */ and /* END AVOID */ comments, verifying correctness of parser changes, and recommending commenting out rather than deleting code for easier future merges (#191)
entry.summary: Merged OxCaml 5.2.0minus-22 bringing quotation support, layout polymorphism, mode system updates, and new jkind primitives

entry.title: Week 41, 2025: Opened PR to merge OCaml 5.2.0minus-22 changes into oxcaml/merlin with AI-assisted conflict resolution
entry.content:
Summary

Opened upstream merge PR with CamlinternalQuote import and source script updates

Activity

  • Mark Shinwell opened PR to merge OCaml 5.2.0minus-22 changes (#191), using AI assistance for conflict resolution and compilation error fixes, importing CamlinternalQuote module and renaming "flambda-backend" references to "oxcaml" in source import script
  • Jack Rickard provided extensive code review on the merge PR (#191) with 10 comments identifying potential issues including odd removals, incorrect descriptions, missing text from oxcaml, and concerns about tailcall handling in antiquotations
entry.summary: Opened PR to merge OCaml 5.2.0minus-22 changes into oxcaml/merlin with AI-assisted conflict resolution

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: Added ppx_template_generated attribute to mark identifiers generated by ppx_template in completion results
entry.content:
Summary

Merged PR implementing ppxtemplategenerated attribute with comprehensive test coverage

Activity

  • ppxtemplategenerated attribute implementation merged by Liam Stevenson with review from @dkalinichenko-js, adding support for marking identifiers generated by ppx_template in completion results (#190)
  • Implementation includes modifications to completion engine (src/analysis/completion.ml), type utilities (src/analysis/type_utils.ml), query protocol (src/frontend/query_protocol.ml), and JSON serialization (src/commands/query_json.ml) (#190)
  • Added comprehensive test suite covering various cases: modules, values, functions, abstract types, and concrete types marked with the attribute (#190)
entry.summary: Added ppx_template_generated attribute to mark identifiers generated by ppx_template in completion results

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Nix infrastructure fixes with flake updates and workflow revert
entry.content:
Summary

Infrastructure maintenance with Nix flake fixes and GitHub workflow cleanup

Activity

  • Nix infrastructure modernization completed by George Shammas with comprehensive flake.lock updates bringing dependencies current including nixpkgs, flake-utils from 2024-03-11 to 2024-11-13, and menhir-repository from 2020-12-16 to 2023-12-31 (#188)
  • GitHub workflow cleanup by Liam Stevenson reverting the automated flake-lock update workflow to prevent unwanted automation (#189)
entry.summary: Nix infrastructure fixes with flake updates and workflow revert

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Active week with 6 merged PRs including major compiler merge, syntax hovers feature, performance fixes, and infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Week dominated by major compiler merge from 5.2.0minus-19 plus infrastructure and build system improvements

Activity

  • Major compiler merge from 5.2.0minus-19 branch completed by Liam Stevenson with extensive changes affecting 163 files (#185)
  • Build and infrastructure improvements including Nix flake updates (#186, #187) and automated flake-lock update workflow
  • Code review collaboration with Simon Spies reviewing shape-related changes, Andrej Ivašković reviewing syntax quotation parts, and Richard Eisenberg providing feedback on merge conflicts
  • Performance and usability focus with exponential algorithm fix and outline command improvements merged during the week
entry.summary: Active week with 6 merged PRs including major compiler merge, syntax hovers feature, performance fixes, and infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: New documentation update PR opened and extensive review activity on syntax hovers implementation
entry.content:
Summary

One new documentation PR opened while ongoing syntax hovers PR received extensive review feedback

Activity

  • Documentation update by Liam Stevenson opened this week to update Menhir version references in readme files (#184)
  • Syntax hovers implementation continued development with Liam Stevenson addressing extensive review feedback from Richard Eisenberg on OCaml syntax documentation strings and mode descriptions (#168)
entry.summary: New documentation update PR opened and extensive review activity on syntax hovers implementation

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Outline API enhancement merged with optional type printing, while syntax hovers and performance fix remain under review
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs opened for syntax hovers and exponential performance fix, plus one merged for outline enhancement

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened this week including oxcaml syntax hover support by Liam Stevenson (#168) and exponential short-paths performance fix (#182)
  • Outline functionality enhancement merged by Liam Stevenson adding include_types parameter to control type information display in outline queries (#183)
  • Performance optimization under review addressing exponential algorithm in short-paths that was causing 40-minute delays in Jane Street codebase, with Leo White providing detailed review feedback on implementation approach (#182)
entry.summary: Outline API enhancement merged with optional type printing, while syntax hovers and performance fix remain under review

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Fixed spurious probe error reporting affecting users through improved error handling
entry.content:
Summary

One PR merged addressing user-reported error issues, two ongoing PRs for enhanced functionality

Activity

  • Merged probe error fix by Liam Stevenson to address user reports of spurious error messages, with review input from @dkalinichenko-js (#181)
  • Ongoing syntax hover enhancement by Liam Stevenson adding oxcaml syntax documentation to hover functionality, with extensive syntax descriptions for review (#168)
  • Multi-type location command by Liam Stevenson awaiting upstream review resolution, with discussion between Richard Eisenberg and author (#148)
  • Query protocol refactoring closed by Liam Stevenson due to upstream changes in the main OCaml merlin repository (#149)
entry.summary: Fixed spurious probe error reporting affecting users through improved error handling

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Improved dot-merlin-reader discovery and merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 compiler changes
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged improving tool integration and compiler compatibility

Activity

  • Dot-merlin-reader improvements by Liam Stevenson implementing enhanced discovery logic with fallback mechanisms, reviewed by Spencer Baugh (#179)
  • Compiler merge by Liam Stevenson integrating OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 changes affecting typing, pattern matching, and core language features, reviewed by @dkalinichenko-js (#180)
entry.summary: Improved dot-merlin-reader discovery and merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 compiler changes

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Major PPX overrides functionality added enabling custom document and locate command behavior through [@@@merlin] attributes
entry.content:
Summary

OCaml compiler merge from 5.2.0minus-17 with extensive typing system updates plus PPX override functionality implementation

Activity

  • PPX overrides implementation by Max Wang with comprehensive caching system using Phasecache.Withcache and GADT-based design for extensible command overrides (#176, #177)
  • OCaml compiler integration by Liam Stevenson merging 5.2.0minus-17 with updates to typing system, scalar types, jkind system, and parser improvements (#178)
  • Upstream synchronization with multiple retag merges ensuring compatibility with latest OCaml flambda changes and maintaining version alignment (#174, #175)
entry.summary: Major PPX overrides functionality added enabling custom document and locate command behavior through [@@@merlin] attributes

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: Major OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 integration plus PPX override system implementation
entry.content:
Summary

PPX override system reached completion with interval tree implementation and caching, plus major compiler backend merge

Activity

  • PPX override system completed with Max Wang implementing interval tree data structure (#173), caching system (#176), and locate support (#171), followed by Liam Stevenson delivering comprehensive improvements (#177)
  • Major compiler integration by Liam Stevenson merging OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 with 34,597 additions and 25,027 deletions across 212 files, including substantial typing system changes (#172)
  • Collaborative development with detailed code review discussions between contributors on interval tree implementation, testing frameworks, and API design decisions
  • Testing improvements including unified tests for PPX functionality, unit tests for interval tree, and server-mode tests with cache hit/miss tracking
entry.summary: Major OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 integration plus PPX override system implementation

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Two important PRs opened: PPX locate support and OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 merge, plus cleanup of older test PRs
entry.content:
Summary

PPX locate support and major OxCaml compiler merge PRs opened alongside cleanup of test and draft PRs

Activity

  • PPX locate support PR opened by Max Wang implementing [@@@merlin.locate] attribute parsing with abstractions for all [@@@merlin] override attributes (#171)
  • OxCaml compiler merge PR opened by Liam Stevenson bringing in changes from OxCaml version 5.2.0minus-16 with extensive typing changes (#172)
  • Repository cleanup with Liam Stevenson closing multiple older draft and test PRs including compiler renaming changes (#140, #150, #163) and test PRs (#160, #161)
  • Draft PPX work by Max Wang closing earlier draft implementation (#170) and test PR (#162)
entry.summary: Two important PRs opened: PPX locate support and OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 merge, plus cleanup of older test PRs

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: PPX integration features development and testing improvements
entry.content:
Summary

PPX support development with syntax hovers and locate functionality

Activity

  • Syntax hover support for oxcaml opened by Liam Stevenson to extend syntax doc command for oxcaml syntax elements with English descriptions (#168)
  • Multi-type location functionality opened by Liam Stevenson implementing locate-type-multi command for enhanced VSCode "Go to Type Definition" with tree structure support (#148)
  • PPX locate support development with Max Wang merging merlin overrides for PPX locate functionality including [@@@merlin.locate] attribute parsing (#171)
  • PPX document support merged by Max Wang implementing [@@@merlin.document] attribute parsing with comprehensive testing for .ml and .mli files (#167)
  • Test stability improvements merged by Liam Stevenson fixing flaky parameterized libs tests with proper merlin server lock usage (#166)
entry.summary: PPX integration features development and testing improvements

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Merged several functional improvements including CI fixes, completion ordering changes, and major renaming feature work
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple CI and testing improvements merged alongside substantial work on project-wide renaming capabilities

Activity

  • CI infrastructure enhancements by Liam Stevenson including workflow dispatch triggers (#164) and pull request workflow support (#165) for better fork collaboration
  • Major renaming feature implementation with Liam Stevenson merging comprehensive changes for project-wide renaming support, including new index format structures and occurrences improvements (#155)
  • Test infrastructure improvements including flaky test fixes for parameterized libs by implementing proper server locking (#166)
  • User experience enhancement through completion order adjustments prioritizing modules over types in expression contexts (#157)
entry.summary: Merged several functional improvements including CI fixes, completion ordering changes, and major renaming feature work

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: One new PR opened for autocompletion improvements with active discussion about completion ordering priorities
entry.content:
Summary

New PR opened for completion order improvements plus ongoing renaming infrastructure work

Activity

  • Autocompletion order optimization opened by Liam Stevenson to prioritize modules over types in expression contexts (#157)
  • Renaming infrastructure work continued with Liam Stevenson creating debug PR for CI issues related to downstream merging (#163)
entry.summary: One new PR opened for autocompletion improvements with active discussion about completion ordering priorities

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: Merlin updated to OCaml 5.2.0minus-14 with jkind API simplification and magic number updates
entry.content:
Summary

One merged PR updating Merlin to OCaml 5.2.0minus-14, with two open PRs for locate fixes and renaming functionality

Activity

  • OCaml compiler integration reached milestone with Liam Stevenson merging upstream changes from OCaml 5.2.0minus-14 including jkind API simplification and magic number updates (#156)
  • Renaming functionality progressed with duplicate PR created by Liam Stevenson to enable CI runs after original by Ulysse encountered issues (#155, #152)
  • Locate improvements continued development with Liam Stevenson working on fixes for punned record pattern navigation, building on prior punned let expression work (#147)
  • Granular marshal development was closed by Ulysse due to conflicts, requiring future rebasing (#143)
entry.summary: Merlin updated to OCaml 5.2.0minus-14 with jkind API simplification and magic number updates

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Major week with six PR merges delivering improved type enclosing, stale occurrence handling, and automation tools
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including locate fixes for punned patterns, while six substantial PRs merged covering tooling and core functionality

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened during the week including Liam Stevenson's move of types to query_protocol_kernel for VSCode extension compatibility (#149), compiler renaming changes integration (#150), and Ulysse's downstream merging work (#152)
  • Six PRs successfully merged with Liam Stevenson delivering major functionality including test failure fixes (#154), compiler merge automation (#122), type enclosing backport from upstream PR 1864 (#131), stale occurrence improvements (#123), and two compiler merge PRs (#151, #153)
  • Ongoing review discussions on locate fixes for punned record patterns with Richard Eisenberg providing feedback and requesting Ulysse's input on the refactoring approach (#147)
  • Substantial compiler integration work with two compiler merge PRs bringing OxCaml up to date with version 5.2.0minus-12 and 5.2.0minus-13 affecting 60+ files across typing, parsing, and utilities (#151, #153)
entry.summary: Major week with six PR merges delivering improved type enclosing, stale occurrence handling, and automation tools

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Updated Merlin to support oxcaml version 5.2.0-minus11 with comprehensive language and typing system changes
entry.content:
Summary

Single major merge bringing Merlin up-to-date with oxcaml 5.2.0-minus11 affecting 206 files

Activity

  • Major oxcaml version update merged by Liam Stevenson updating Merlin to support oxcaml 5.2.0-minus11 with extensive changes across parsing, typing, and analysis modules (#146)
  • Comprehensive codebase synchronization affecting 206 files with 37,047 additions and 30,122 deletions including parser updates, typing system enhancements, and language extension support (#146)
  • Resolved compilation unit discussion regarding Unit_info.make_with_known_compilation_unit usage with plans for follow-up discussions on future improvements (#146)
entry.summary: Updated Merlin to support oxcaml version 5.2.0-minus11 with comprehensive language and typing system changes

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Three new PRs opened for IDE enhancements and compiler version update
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including multi-type location command and punned pattern fixes

Activity

  • New IDE functionality introduced with Liam Stevenson opening locate-type-multi command PR that enables enhanced VSCode type navigation for complex types like a -> (b * c) (#148)
  • Pattern matching improvements with punned record pattern locate fixes opened by Liam Stevenson, addressing cases where { a; b } pattern navigation incorrectly focuses on pattern instead of label definition (#147)
  • Compiler integration work with OxCaml 5.2.0-minus11 merge PR opened by Liam Stevenson, involving extensive review collaboration with Richard Eisenberg and Luke Maurer (#146)
entry.summary: Three new PRs opened for IDE enhancements and compiler version update

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Updated Merlin compatibility for OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 with magic number bumps and version support
entry.content:
Summary

Single maintenance PR merged for OCaml version compatibility with review discussion about commit clarity

Activity

  • Version compatibility update merged by Chris Casinghino to support OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 with Liam Stevenson conducting code review and managing the merge process (#144)
  • Review process included discussion about reverting unclear commits, with Liam Stevenson making decisions to revert commits while @d-kalinichenko and Chris Casinghino were unavailable (#144)
entry.summary: Updated Merlin compatibility for OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 with magic number bumps and version support

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: Merged PR #145 removing runtime float32 support and cherry-picking msupport_parsing patch for 5.2.0minus-9 compatibility
entry.content:
Summary

Single PR merged addressing OCaml compiler compatibility issues for 5.2.0minus-9

Activity

  • Compiler compatibility improvements merged by Patrick Ferris with focus on 5.2.0minus-9 magic numbers and float32 runtime conflict resolution (#145)
entry.summary: Merged PR #145 removing runtime float32 support and cherry-picking msupport_parsing patch for 5.2.0minus-9 compatibility

entry.content:

Single PR opened for downstream granular marshal changes but later closed due to conflicts

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Fixed critical jump-to-definition bug when compilation unit names match current file names
entry.content:
Summary

Single bug fix merged addressing critical jump-to-definition functionality

Activity

  • Jump-to-definition bug fix merged by Liam Stevenson resolving assertion failures when files share names with compilation units, including comprehensive test coverage (#142)
entry.summary: Fixed critical jump-to-definition bug when compilation unit names match current file names

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Menhir version upgrade and OCaml compiler updates with mode crossing enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs opened for project-wide renaming features, both later closed without merging

Activity

  • Project-wide renaming implementation attempts by Ulysse with two separate PRs opened this week (#139, #140) featuring compiler updates, UID disambiguation, and Granular Marshal indexer integration, though both were later closed without merging
  • OCaml compiler synchronization work completed by Richard Eisenberg updating to 5.2.0minus-9 (#141) with routine typing system updates and test behavior modifications
  • Build infrastructure improvements by Liam Stevenson implementing Menhir version checks in CI pipeline (#138) to prevent compilation issues from version mismatches
entry.summary: Menhir version upgrade and OCaml compiler updates with mode crossing enhancements

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: OCaml 5.2.0minus-9 integration merged with extensive typing system and parser updates
entry.content:
Summary

Single large integration PR merged updating Merlin's OCaml backend to 5.2.0minus-9 with extensive testing updates

Activity

  • OCaml 5.2.0minus-9 integration completed by Richard Eisenberg importing upstream OCaml sources, resolving conflicts, fixing type errors, and updating version numbers (#137)
  • Comprehensive testing updates with promoted test cases and formatting changes across 106 files affecting core typing system, parser recovery, and analysis modules (#137)
  • Upstream synchronization maintaining compatibility with flambda-backend at commit c3c58afb390 for continued development alignment (#137)

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Major upstream OCaml flambda merge updating typing system, parser, and magic numbers
entry.content:
Summary

Single large upstream merge from OCaml flambda affecting core typing and parsing systems

Activity

  • Upstream merge completed by Liam Stevenson integrating OCaml flambda changes across 136 files with straightforward conflict resolution (#136)
  • Core typing system substantially updated including jkind, mode analysis, type declarations, and uniqueness analysis modules (#136)
  • Test suite updated to reflect new magic numbers and typing system behavior changes (#136)
entry.summary: Major upstream OCaml flambda merge updating typing system, parser, and magic numbers

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Updated OCaml 5.2.0minus-7 version with magic number changes and Layouts extension status change
entry.content:
Summary

Single maintenance PR merged to update version compatibility and extension status

Activity

  • Version update merged by Liam Stevenson to incorporate OCaml 5.2.0minus-7 changes with no conflicts from import script (#135)
entry.summary: Updated OCaml 5.2.0minus-7 version with magic number changes and Layouts extension status change

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Major OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 integration update and test infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged focusing on compiler compatibility and test infrastructure reliability

Activity

  • OCaml compiler integration completed by Richard Eisenberg with comprehensive 5.2.0minus-6 update affecting 168 files and 17k+ line changes (#132)
  • Test infrastructure improvements by Liam Stevenson fixing flaky parameter test failures through proper server lifecycle management (#134)
  • Draft merge attempt by Liam Stevenson was closed without merging, likely superseded by the successful integration work (#133)
entry.summary: Major OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 integration update and test infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Parameter flag support and improved file disambiguation merged, plus OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 update opened
entry.content:
Summary

Large OCaml compiler update opened while parameter flag support and file disambiguation features merged

Activity

  • OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 update opened by Richard Eisenberg with 17,417 additions and 15,442 deletions across 167 files (#132)
  • Parameter flag implementation by Luke Maurer merged after comprehensive review process including tests for configuration changes and .merlin file support (#128)
  • File disambiguation feature by Liam Stevenson backported from upstream merlin to improve jump-to-definition accuracy (#130)
entry.summary: Parameter flag support and improved file disambiguation merged, plus OCaml 5.2.0minus-6 update opened

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Two significant PRs opened to backport upstream improvements for type-enclosing query behavior and file distinction capabilities
entry.content:
Summary

Two major PRs opened for backporting upstream improvements to type-enclosing queries and file distinction plus one draft PR closed

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened this week by Liam Stevenson including backport of upstream type-enclosing query improvements (#131) and file distinction capabilities (#130)
  • Type-enclosing query improvements backported from ocaml/merlin#1864 to fix deduplication issues that caused unstable results when progressively expanding query ranges (#131)
  • File distinction functionality backported from ocaml/merlin#1882 to enable jumping to definitions between files with identical contents (#130)
  • Draft PR closed for let pun occurrences test that had been open since October (#109)
entry.summary: Two significant PRs opened to backport upstream improvements for type-enclosing query behavior and file distinction capabilities

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Two PRs merged including typed hole module addition and persistent env fix, plus new parameter flag feature opened
entry.content:
Summary

New parameter flag feature opened for parameterized modules while two other PRs completed development cycle

Activity

  • Parameter flag processing feature opened by Luke Maurer to support -parameter flag for parameterized modules, addressing errors when editing parameterized libraries (#128)
  • Typed hole module migration completed by Liam Stevenson to reduce diff with upstream ocaml-lsp by backporting module from upstream merlin (#129)
  • Instance name handling fixed by Luke Maurer restoring change that was inadvertently dropped during flambda-backend merge (#127)
entry.summary: Two PRs merged including typed hole module addition and persistent env fix, plus new parameter flag feature opened

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Major flambda backend merge bringing unboxed record types and overwrite syntax support
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged this week: major flambda 5.2.0minus-5 integration and subsequent parser fix

Activity

  • Major upstream merge completed by Liam Stevenson integrating flambda 5.2.0minus-5 changes with extensive type system updates (#124)
  • Parser conflict fix merged to resolve reduce/reduce conflicts introduced by the flambda merge, affecting underscore parsing in overwrite statements (#126)
  • Test infrastructure expanded with comprehensive unboxed records test suite demonstrating new language features and identifying areas for improvement
entry.summary: Major flambda backend merge bringing unboxed record types and overwrite syntax support

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Substantial flambda merge PR opened with unboxed types support and typed holes improvements across 207 files.
entry.content:
Summary

Major flambda changes merge opened for 5.2.0minus-5 with unboxed types support and typed holes architecture improvements.

Activity

  • Flambda merge for 5.2.0minus-5 opened by Liam Stevenson with comprehensive changes affecting 207 files including unboxed types support and typed holes architecture improvements (#124)
  • Unboxed types integration represents partial Merlin support with known limitations, including test file demonstrating current capabilities and planned improvements for better compatibility
  • Typed holes architecture underwent refinement to resolve conflicts between compiler's native hole support and Merlin's existing implementation, introducing distinction between Texp_hole and Texp_typed_hole constructors
  • CI testing improvements explored through draft PR for infrastructure validation (#125)
entry.summary: Substantial flambda merge PR opened with unboxed types support and typed holes improvements across 207 files.

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Single PR opened for improving stale occurrence detection in project-wide searches
entry.content:
Summary

One PR opened for improving Merlin's stale occurrence detection with upstream collaboration

Activity

  • Liam Stevenson opened stale occurrence detection improvement PR addressing path alignment bugs and changing behavior to flag rather than discard stale occurrences (#123)
  • Upstream collaboration initiated with ocaml/merlin#1885 as mentioned in PR comments
  • Richard Eisenberg provided review coordination connecting the contributor with domain experts
entry.summary: Single PR opened for improving stale occurrence detection in project-wide searches

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Two PRs opened by Liam Stevenson: compiler merge bot automation and flambda parameter fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged: automated compiler merge detection bot and updated ignored flambda parameters

Activity

  • Automation tooling added with compiler merge bot by Liam Stevenson that detects compiler merge PRs and provides task checklists (#122)
  • Flambda parameter maintenance completed by Liam Stevenson adding missing ignored flags from versions 5.1.1minus-24 to 5.2.0minus-4 (#121)
entry.summary: Two PRs opened by Liam Stevenson: compiler merge bot automation and flambda parameter fixes

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Major OCaml compiler integration update bringing version 5.2.0minus-4 changes to Merlin
entry.content:
Summary

Completed integration of OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 compiler changes with focused review on jkind printing improvements

Activity

  • Compiler integration merge completed by Liam Stevenson bringing OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 changes into Merlin with 23,205 additions and 21,060 deletions across 143 files (#120)
  • Focused code review by Richard Eisenberg on jkind annotation printing changes and constructor argument handling, confirming the removal of automatic jkind annotation printing for @@unboxed types (#120)
  • Technical collaboration involving Zesen Qian for specific aspects of the compiler integration and code review process (#120)
entry.summary: Major OCaml compiler integration update bringing version 5.2.0minus-4 changes to Merlin

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Integration of OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 compiler changes with jkind printing improvements and modal module syntax updates
entry.content:
Summary

Major compiler integration work merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 with extensive testing and conflict resolution

Activity

  • Compiler integration from OCaml flambda-backend version 5.2.0minus-4 imported by Liam Stevenson with comprehensive conflict resolution and testing (#120)
  • Type system updates across 143 files affecting jkind handling, modal modules, and AST representations with particular focus on printing and conversion logic (aabad19 through 30323e1)
  • Magic number updates and test promotion following integration to ensure compatibility with new compiler version (e309d55)

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: None

entry.summary: Activity report for oxcaml/merlin - Week 47, 2024

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Merlin merged major 5.2.0minus-3 compiler sync with new directory layout support and jane syntax removal
entry.content:
Summary

Major compiler synchronization to 5.2.0minus-3 with comprehensive directory restructuring and jane syntax cleanup

Activity

  • Compiler synchronization completed by Liam Stevenson bringing Merlin up to date with OCaml 5.2.0minus-3, involving complex merge resolution due to directory layout changes and dependency cycles (#119)
  • Jane syntax removal throughout parsing modules with comprehensive cleanup of janesyntax.ml, janesyntax.mli, janesyntaxparsing.ml, and parser_types.ml files to streamline syntax handling (#119)
  • Directory restructuring adaptation with import scripts modified to handle both old ocaml/ subdirectory structure and new flat directory layout from flambda-backend repository (#119)
  • Dependency cycle resolution by moving Language_extension module from utils/ to parsing/ directory, addressing conflicts between parsing and utils directories while maintaining existing functionality (#119)
  • Release preparation with version 5.2.0minus-3 tagged and released following successful merge completion (#119)
entry.summary: Merlin merged major 5.2.0minus-3 compiler sync with new directory layout support and jane syntax removal

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Enhanced LSP hover interaction for stack-or-heap analysis and improved opam compatibility
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged focusing on LSP integration improvements and build system compatibility

Activity

  • LSP hover interaction improvements merged by David Vulakh with enhanced stack-or-heap analysis providing better location consistency for constructors and function patterns, gated behind new -lsp-compat flag (#116)
  • Opam compatibility fixes merged by Nick Roberts removing unused Compression module and addressing missing dependency issues (#114)
  • Draft PR closed by Nick Roberts for bleeding-edge-with-extensions compatibility work that was marked as demo-only (#111)
entry.summary: Enhanced LSP hover interaction for stack-or-heap analysis and improved opam compatibility

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Two new diagnostic commands added and LSP hover improvements implemented for stack-or-heap queries
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened with one for LSP improvements and four total PRs with two merged and one closed

Activity

  • David Vulakh opened LSP compatibility improvements for stack-or-heap queries with special cases for constructor and function binding patterns (#116)
  • Liam Stevenson opened test PR to trigger CI pipeline (#118)
  • Diagnostic tooling enhanced through two merged contributions by Liam Stevenson: dump-file-stats command for index metadata inspection (#115) and magic numbers printing command for compatibility testing (#117)
entry.summary: Two new diagnostic commands added and LSP hover improvements implemented for stack-or-heap queries

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Merged three PRs improving let punning occurrences, promoting Sherlodoc parser, and updating opam compatibility
entry.content:
Summary

One draft PR opened for merlin-jst compatibility while three PRs merged for core improvements

Activity

  • Draft PR opened by Nick Roberts for making merlin-jst compatible with bleeding-edge-with-extensions (#111), marked as demo purposes with 7531 additions and 6908 deletions across 12 files
  • Let punning support completed by Liam Stevenson with occurrence filtering improvements that change from ghost location filtering to Location.none filtering, enabling better identifier tracking in punned expressions (#110)
  • Sherlodoc integration finalized by Nick Roberts through backporting ocaml/ocaml#1843 to simplify merlin-jst opam package setup (#113)
  • Opam compatibility enhanced by Nick Roberts removing unused modules and fixing dependency issues for better integration with opam switches (#114)
  • OCaml 5.2.0minus import completed by Liam Stevenson with minimal changes to maintain compatibility with upstream OCaml development (#112)
entry.summary: Merged three PRs improving let punning occurrences, promoting Sherlodoc parser, and updating opam compatibility

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Enhanced locate command with context overrides and merged major OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 changes plus tooling improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple infrastructure improvements including OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 merge and cleanup of unused magic numbers

Activity

  • Locate command enhancement completed by Liam Stevenson adding flexible context override capability for precise namespace searches, enabling users to specify exact identifier search contexts rather than relying on position inference (#91)
  • OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration delivered through comprehensive upstream merge by Liam Stevenson, bringing latest flambda backend changes while temporarily deferring parameterized module support (#106)
  • Development tooling improved with new automated magic numbers update script by Liam Stevenson, streamlining OCaml version compatibility maintenance with validation and error checking (#108)
  • Code cleanup completed by Liam Stevenson removing unused magic numbers from configuration, reducing maintenance overhead and potential confusion (#107)
  • Bug fix implemented by Liam Stevenson for EXCLUDEQUERYDIR directive handling in cmt/cms files, with intention to upstream the fix to main OCaml merlin (#104)
  • Occurrences query improvement merged by Liam Stevenson switching from ghost location to Location.none filtering, coordinated with related ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend#3137 changes (#110)
entry.summary: Enhanced locate command with context overrides and merged major OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 changes plus tooling improvements
